content.html:
StreetPass is a cool new browser extension that uses Mastodon's verification system in a clever way.

Mastodon users verify themselves by adding a custom link to their personal site. StreetPass lets you know when you've found one of these links, and adds them to your list. As you browse the web, StreetPass will build a list of Mastodon users that belong to the websites you visit.

I spoke with the creater @tvler about the project, 🧵 below.

Visit https://streetpass.social/ to try it yourself!
content.value: StreetPass is a cool new browser extension that uses Mastodon's verification system in a clever way.Mastodon users verify themselves by adding a custom link to their personal site. StreetPass lets you know when you've found one of these links, and adds them to your list. As you browse the web, StreetPass will build a list of Mastodon users that belong to the websites you visit.I spoke with the creater @tvler about the project, 🧵 below.Visit https://streetpass.social/ to try it yourself!

photo.alt: screenshot showing a dropdown menu when someone uses StreetPass. It shows a list of Mastodon profiles that are affiliated with the websites that youve visited

content.html: Little bit of street #Photography from Sunday.
content.value: Little bit of street #Photography from Sunday.

photo.alt: A long haired young man walks past camera, only his left upper arm tattoos in focus. He was singing to himself - not that you can see that in the photo.
A metal can turned into a letter box long ago is rusted and ruined in the foreground, the terrace house it's associated with out of focus behind it and in almost as-bad condition.
A ruined, abandoned, graffiti-laiden terrace house.
A cement staircase leading up to the roof of a small warehouse, whose roof has been torn off and 'replaced' by a tarpaulin, which hangs limply down its side.

content.html: I think I could almost get back into Magic The Gathering or things like 40k if I could find ways to make them More Swingy. Optimal play for both of these usually involves controlling the randomness of outcomes but for someone who doesn't want to have to play optimally with decks and lists from the internet, that just leads to me feeling like I've lost before I've started playing most of the time. I want variants of 40k or Hearthstone or whatever where the top tier best decklists still lose to random bullshit every handful of matches. More insane Hail Mary payoffs etc please. I want to have fun playing, not spending hours preparing to be the best.
content.value: I think I could almost get back into Magic The Gathering or things like 40k if I could find ways to make them More Swingy. Optimal play for both of these usually involves controlling the randomness of outcomes but for someone who doesn't want to have to play optimally with decks and lists from the internet, that just leads to me feeling like I've lost before I've started playing most of the time. I want variants of 40k or Hearthstone or whatever where the top tier best decklists still lose to random bullshit every handful of matches. More insane Hail Mary payoffs etc please. I want to have fun playing, not spending hours preparing to be the best.

content.html:
Banner and title art for Deck & Conn is done, which means - the itch.io page is up!

Really quite happy with this - I think it's pretty evocative of the feel of the game generally.

Relaxing evening left for me now, before I get back into development on it after work tomorrow.

#GameDev #IndieDev

https://expectproblems.itch.io/deck-and-conn

An image of a Star Trek style main viewer in pixel art, with stars streaking by as the golden words "DECK + CONN" sit over the starfield.

Around the console are numerous buttons, displays and vents.

content.html: Watched Wendell & Wild and holy shit that was some of the most visually stunning stop motion paired with some of the worst storytelling I've ever encountered. Utterly baffling.

photo.alt: sketch of the prompt "a punk girl with a black undercut and a leather jacket, pretending she isn't embarrassed that you caught her taking food out of the garbage". She eats a cheeseburger and has sauce bits on her chin. Blushing, she has 3 speech bubbles: 1) ... 2) ... What? 3) It's *fresh*! I'm not gonna waste *food*!

content.html:
And as a reminder--as this nice person explaining things points out--just because something is a social construct doesn't mean it doesn't have a real impact on one's life.

Money, for example, is a social construct.

RT @joelbervell@twitter.com

Here’s an example of how race is a social construct. #Science #genetics #medicine #biracial

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/joelbervell/status/1619726148333887494

content.html:
Cab Ride is two today! 🚇 🥳

I'm really proud of this game. A weird mix of things coming together, semi-by accident, but turned into something that resonated with people. Was nice to find others were looking for a strange train experience too.

Also, my brother did an amazing job on the soundtrack.

Also also also, I have now played Densha De Go 🤣 (I got the Switch version)

https://powersaurus.itch.io/cab-ride

#pico8

content.html: Finally switched back to my second generation Chromecast today cause I just just cannot deal with how unreliable and buggy the gen 3 "Chromecast With Google Tv" is. What a prime example of product bloat making something actively less usable.
